body_html:
I have made sure that the cudnn libraries are located in the /local/usr/cuda/lib64 and /local/usr/cuda/include:

If they were not, I could not build tensorflow with cuda support

cookie@ceres:~/work/machine_learning/tensorflow/tools$ ls -l /usr/local/cuda/lib64/libcudnn*
-rwxr-xr-x 1 root root 148M Jun 21 07:31 /usr/local/cuda/lib64/libcudnn.so
-rwxr-xr-x 1 root root 148M Jun 21 07:31 /usr/local/cuda/lib64/libcudnn.so.6
-rwxr-xr-x 1 root root 148M Jun 21 07:31 /usr/local/cuda/lib64/libcudnn.so.6.0.21
-rw-r--r-- 1 root root 138M Jun 21 07:31 /usr/local/cuda/lib64/libcudnn_static.a

Is there anything else I can check or do? The flowers_train script runs for multiple interations, before it crashes each time with different errors, as below:

2017-06-21 10:32:20.376515: step 17080, loss = 0.96 (62.9 examples/sec; 0.509 sec/batch)
2017-06-21 10:32:25.431246: step 17090, loss = 0.96 (62.7 examples/sec; 0.511 sec/batch)
2017-06-21 10:32:30.495980: step 17100, loss = 0.89 (62.9 examples/sec; 0.509 sec/batch)
2017-06-21 10:32:33.929246: E tensorflow/stream_executor/cuda/cuda_event.cc:49] Error polling for event status: failed to query event: CUDA_ERROR_ILLEGAL_ADDRESS
2017-06-21 10:32:33.929280: F tensorflow/core/common_runtime/gpu/gpu_event_mgr.cc:203] Unexpected Event status: 1

If they were not, I could not build tensorflow with cuda support

Is there anything else I can check or do? The flowers_train script runs for multiple interations, before it crashes each time with different errors, as below:

2017-06-21 10:32:25.431246: step 17090, loss = 0.96 (62.7 examples/sec; 0.511 sec/batch)

body:
I have made sure that the cudnn libraries are located in the /local/usr/cuda/lib64 and /local/usr/cuda/include:

If they were not, I could not build tensorflow with cuda support

cookie@ceres:~/work/machine_learning/tensorflow/tools$ ls -l /usr/local/cuda/lib64/libcudnn*
-rwxr-xr-x 1 root root 148M Jun 21 07:31 /usr/local/cuda/lib64/libcudnn.so
-rwxr-xr-x 1 root root 148M Jun 21 07:31 /usr/local/cuda/lib64/libcudnn.so.6
-rwxr-xr-x 1 root root 148M Jun 21 07:31 /usr/local/cuda/lib64/libcudnn.so.6.0.21
-rw-r--r-- 1 root root 138M Jun 21 07:31 /usr/local/cuda/lib64/libcudnn_static.a

Is there anything else I can check or do? The flowers_train script runs for multiple interations, before it crashes each time with different errors, as below:

2017-06-21 10:32:20.376515: step 17080, loss = 0.96 (62.9 examples/sec; 0.509 sec/batch)
2017-06-21 10:32:25.431246: step 17090, loss = 0.96 (62.7 examples/sec; 0.511 sec/batch)
2017-06-21 10:32:30.495980: step 17100, loss = 0.89 (62.9 examples/sec; 0.509 sec/batch)
2017-06-21 10:32:33.929246: E tensorflow/stream_executor/cuda/cuda_event.cc:49] Error polling for event status: failed to query event: CUDA_ERROR_ILLEGAL_ADDRESS
2017-06-21 10:32:33.929280: F tensorflow/core/common_runtime/gpu/gpu_event_mgr.cc:203] Unexpected Event status: 1
